name: One Word Movie Titles Trivia Quiz | Name the Movie | 10 Questions

questions.text: Big sea creature, too small of a boat, Martha's Vineyard?
questions.explanation:
Jaws.

	Martha's Vineyard was used as Amity Island.

questions.text: Indiana high school basketball championship, Gene Hackman - true story.
questions.explanation:
Hoosiers.

	This movie is about the 1954 Indiana high school championship when Milan beat Muncie (a much bigger school) 32-30.

questions.text: Renegade angels, God portrayed by a female, loophole into heaven?
questions.explanation:
Dogma.

	Alanis Morissette portrayed God in the Kevin Smith movie.

questions.text: Sequel to "Best Picture" winner, brains as food, Thomas Harris?
questions.explanation:
Hannibal.

	"Hannibal" was written by Thomas Harris and was the sequel to "Silence of the Lambs".

questions.text: Cast member from "Who's the Boss", saint bernard, Indian word meaning "unstoppable force"?
questions.explanation:
Cujo.

	Danny Pitauro who played Johnathan Bower on "Who's the Boss" played the little boy stuck in the car with Dee Wallace-Stone.

questions.text: No dancing allowed, preacher's daughter, Kenny Loggin's song?
questions.explanation:
Footloose.

	This is a story about a city where dancing in banned and the Preacher's daughter played by Lori Singer helps Ren McCormack (Kevin Bacon) find a way around that law so they can hold the school's Prom.

questions.text: Based on a TV show, dolphin, Coral Key?
questions.explanation:
Flipper.

	The setting was Coral Key in Florida and starred Elijah Wood and Paul Hogan.

Grease.

	This musical starred Olivia Newton-John and John Travolta.

Ali.

	Will Smith received an Oscar Nomination for his portrayal of Muhammad Ali.

questions.text: Michael J. Fox as a bowler, dying Uncle, family fighting over inheritance?
questions.explanation:
Greedy.

	Kirk Douglas played the dying Uncle in this comedy featuring an Allstar Cast.
